item.title: 000.diss.Writing Guide
item.description: Dissertation Structure from authoring a phd Writing Format Total writing: < 40k-80k words (~160 pages double-spaced @ 40k, 320 double-spaced @ 80k words) 6 Chapters @ 5-10k words per chapter, (~20-30 pages double-spaced @ 5-8k, single-spaced @ 8-15k) Structure LEAD IN: 1-50/60 pages, 1-2 Chapters. CORE: 50-60 pages, 5 chapters @ 50k words maximum) LEAD OUT (p. 62): 1-2 chapters Should bring together and integrate conclusions from core chapters should cover different compenets of research should “open out” to of results to wider literature, theory and lit discussion saved until end Chapter Organization 10k words/chapter

item.title: 010.Chapters at-a-glance
item.description: Chapters At-a-glance #original Return of the Vietnamese westerners: Second Generation return migration to Viet Nam in the digital age. Legend | ‚òÄÔ∏è >80% developed | üåä developing | üå± just sprouted üåäIntroduction: The westerners return üß†[Detailed] 031.Chapter1_intro ‚òÄÔ∏èChapter 2 (un)settling home (How second-gen VK ended up in western countries) üß†[Detailed] 032.Chapter2_westerners Introduction (200-1k words) Begin with a qualitative quote? situating within a transnational context Section I: departure: a push from the ancestral homeland (Outward migration of 1st generation from Viet Nam) Pre-1975 (1 wave) Post-1975 (3 waves) Refugee (boat people) orderly departure program (ODP) Humanitarian Operation (HO) Skilled migrants Work migrants (japan today) Hinting at factors that shape return to VN Section II: arrival: born and raised in the West background of western countries statistics of success or failure of viets Terms to Define

item.title: 010.diss.2 Narative Arcs + Research Qs
item.description: Two Narative Arcs + Research Qs Research Qs + 2 Narative Arcs and Chapter at-a-glance 2 NARRATIVE ARCS: ICTs construct a present/different/future narrative of Vietnameseness. Main Research Q How do ICTs mediate experiences of belonging and identity construction of second generation Viet Kieu after return migrating to Viet Nam? Theoretical framework transnational social fields, methodological cosmopolitanism migrant capital 2 Narative Arcs (at-a-glance): 1st arc (Chaps 1-3): For 2nd gen, there was a lack or absence of ICTs in the imaginary of VN while growing up and connecting to VN.

item.title: 020.Annotated Bibliography
item.description: üå±Annotated Bibliography Annotated bibliography: bib and 2-3 sentences outlining how it connects to research. Organize them by subtopics. Then alphabetically by topic Return Migration 2nd gen return Max M√ºler, returns of german contract workers. Gendered experiences. Similar to my own research! Oxfield and Long. ÔªøLong, Lynellyn D., and Ellen Oxfeld. 2004a. Introduction. In Coming Home? Refugees, Migrants, and Those Who Stayed Behind, ed. Lynellyn D. Long and Ellen Oxfeld, 1‚Äì15.

item.title: Chapter1_intro
item.description: Chapter1: (Preface? and) Introduction #organizeme #üå± Chapter 1 Introduction (write at the end of dissertation) Check out: Research Qs + 2 Narative Arcs and Chapter at-a-glance Introduction (200-1k words) 0.0 2010s was an unprecedented time for migration. Vietnamese migrants leaving Viet nam in the form of labor migration . Occurring through Regular and irregular channels. Vietnamese diasporic migration into Vietnam. a. 2019 essex lorry incident resulting in 39 deaths brought to the limelight the treacherous nature of international labor migration (Stuart Hall‚Äôs Cosmopolitanism from below).

item.title: Chapter2_westerners
item.description: Chapter2: The Vietnamese Westerners: Life in the natal home #‚òÄÔ∏è Check out: Research Qs + 2 Narative Arks and Chapters at-a-glance Section I: The Vietnamese westerner: **(un)settling home (How second-gen Viet Kieu ended up in western countries) Preface/intro: the lack or absence of ICTs in the imaginary of VN while growing up and connecting to VN for the 2nd generation. 2nd gens relied on the 1st gen or diasporic media to connect with motherland.

item.title: Chapter3: From foreigner to Westerner: (Re)negotiating identity in the ethnic homeland
item.description: Chapter4 The Return from foreigner to Westerner: (Re)negotiating identity in the ethnic homeland #üå± Check out: Research Qs + 2 Narative Arks and Chapter at-a-glance Section I: Inroduction: From my #qualitative research: They are outsiders in their birth home and become westerners in their ancestral homeland. When a return is not a return. Jana K Lipman ‚Äôs epilogue (p 234) account of Pham Chi Cuong, 1.

item.title: Chapter4_ICTs
item.description: Chapter5 #üå± Check out: Research Qs + 2 Narative Arks and Chapter at-a-glance Questions to answer: How do ICTs create a feeling of connectedness of home? Do ICTs create connectedness between coethnics? Chapter 4: Transnational virtual networks: Mediating assimilation/acculturation via ICTs 5.0 Is it technology that binds? 5.0.1 ÔªøTechnological explanations for the emergence of more transnational patterns of migration prove to be incomplete when divorced from an analysis of the social relations of production.

item.title: Chapter6
item.description: Chapter6 National Identities, the Nation-state and Local perception #üå± Check out: Research Qs + 2 Narative Arks and Chapter at-a-glance 6.1 The State (recognition, Priscila Koh and Recycling Migrations research article) 6.2 citizenship (+visas, on FB groups) 6.2.1 ashley carruther‚Äôs national belonging in transnational fields article. Citizenship makes one belong more or less (p. 426) legal vs performative citizenship (p. 427) 6.3 property ownership
